column2: Are you sure you want to do this?

column1: Optimization failed because PHP exec() function is disabled.
column2: Optimization failed because PHP exec() function is disabled.

column1: Scan and reindex operations completed successfully.
column2: Scan and reindex operations completed successfully.

column1: Number of images to be optimized per request.
column2: Number of images to be optimized per request.

column1: Paths to be scanned for images.
column2: Paths to be scanned for images.

column1:
Paths are relative to your Magento root directory.
Use "/" as directory separator.
Use ";" to separate paths.
column2:
Paths are relative to your Magento root directory.
Use "/" as directory separator.
Use ";" to separate paths.

column1: Bar on the right represents how many images are optimized.
column2: Bar on the right represents how many images are optimized.

column1:
Every time you click "Start Optimization Process" (or cron job executes) depending on "Batch Size" value and number of indexed files, progress bar will move.
If progress bar does not move most likely reason is file permissions.
Utility binaries located in module_root/bin must be executable which means you have to set right permissions on files inside this directory.
If you are getting less than 100% despite you clicked "Start Optimization Process" button more than several times and the percentage is stuck to same value that means some of your files are corrupt. To find out which files are corrupt in "Utility" section for "Log Utility Output" select "Yes". Refresh your cache and click "Start Optimization Process" button again. After it is done you will find a list of corrupt files in
var/log/debug.log
You can inspect the log and fix the files yourself. Do not forget to set "Log Utility Output" back to "No".
column2:
Every time you click "Start Optimization Process" (or cron job executes) depending on "Batch Size" value and number of indexed files, progress bar will move.
If progress bar does not move most likely reason is file permissions.
Utility binaries located in module_root/bin must be executable which means you have to set right permissions on files inside this directory.
If you are getting less than 100% despite you clicked "Start Optimization Process" button more than several times and the percentage is stuck to same value that means some of your files are corrupt. To find out which files are corrupt in "Utility" section for "Log Utility Output" select "Yes". Refresh your cache and click "Start Optimization Process" button again. After it is done you will find a list of corrupt files in
var/log/debug.log
You can inspect the log and fix the files yourself. Do not forget to set "Log Utility Output" back to "No".

column1: This resets above progress bar and you will have to index and optimize all images again.
column2: This resets above progress bar and you will have to index and optimize all images again.

column1: WARNING! Do not change any options! (Unless you know what you are doing.)
column2: WARNING! Do not change any options! (Unless you know what you are doing.)

column1: Enable Scan and Reindex Process Cron Job
column2: Enable Scan and Reindex Process Cron Job

column1: Enables or disables scan and reindex process cron job.
column2: Enables or disables scan and reindex process cron job.

column1: Cron Expression for Scan and Reindex Process
column2: Cron Expression for Scan and Reindex Process

column1: Cron expression used to trigger scan and reindex process. Example: 15 4 * * * (once a day at 4:15 AM)
column2: Cron expression used to trigger scan and reindex process. Example: 15 4 * * * (once a day at 4:15 AM)

column1:
Examples:
*/5 * * * * (every 5 minutes)
0,30 * * * * (twice an hour)
0 * * * * (once an hour)
0 0,12 * * * (twice a day)
0 0 * * * (once a day)
0 0 * * 0 (once a week)
0 0 1,15 * * (1st and 15th)
0 0 1 * * (once a month)
0 0 1 1 * (once a year)
column2:
Examples:
*/5 * * * * (every 5 minutes)
0,30 * * * * (twice an hour)
0 * * * * (once an hour)
0 0,12 * * * (twice a day)
0 0 * * * (once a day)
0 0 * * 0 (once a week)
0 0 1,15 * * (1st and 15th)
0 0 1 * * (once a month)
0 0 1 1 * (once a year)

column1: Enables or disables optimization process cron job.
column2: Enables or disables optimization process cron job.

column1: Cron expression used to trigger image optimization process. Example: 0 * * * * (once an hour)
column2: Cron expression used to trigger image optimization process. Example: 0 * * * * (once an hour)

column1: Use only if your site is on 64-bit server.
column2: Use only if your site is on 64-bit server.

column1: Log output information generated by utilities.
column2: Log output information generated by utilities.

column1: Force file permissions after optimization. Example: 0644
column2: Force file permissions after optimization. Example: 0644

column1: Optimization utilities might change permissions of files they optimize (usually to 0644 or 0666). Use this option to force permissions you want. If you do not want to force file permission leave this field empty.
column2: Optimization utilities might change permissions of files they optimize (usually to 0644 or 0666). Use this option to force permissions you want. If you do not want to force file permission leave this field empty.

column1:
Path is relative to module root directory.
Module root directory can be app/code/Apptrian/ImageOptimizer
or
vendor/apptrian/image-optimizer
Use "/" as directory separator.
Inside this directory you must have following directories:
elf32
elf64
win32
win64
Inside these directories put command line binaries.
column2:
Path is relative to module root directory.
Module root directory can be app/code/Apptrian/ImageOptimizer
or
vendor/apptrian/image-optimizer
Use "/" as directory separator.
Inside this directory you must have following directories:
elf32
elf64
win32
win64
Inside these directories put command line binaries.

column1:
Do not include the .exe extension for Windows binaries.
Command line binaries only!
column2:
Do not include the .exe extension for Windows binaries.

column1: WARNING! Read the tooltip for more information.
column2: WARNING! Read the tooltip for more information.

column1:
If utility you want to use is already installed on your server, you can specify exact path to it. When generating command this exact path to utility will be used and then "Utility Options" will be appended to it. Example:
/usr/bin/gifsicle
If your utility is added to your system path (which means it is accessible from every directory) then type only utility executable filename. If you do not want to use this option leave this field empty. (Do not leave any white space characters.)
column2:

column1: The %filepath% will be substituted with image file path by the extension.
